result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Straight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Warrant was canceled. Talked to Sheila at GLSO.

1:04 pm
 Defendant James A Straight appeared by phone means in custody from Fond du Lac County Jail and without counsel.
Court questions Defendant as to why he has not made payments.  Defendant makes statement regarding recent surgeries and pending application for disability.
Court quashes current Warrant.
Court orders Defendant to pay $15 per month, beginning June 30, 2017, and continuing the last day of every month, until paid in full or Defendant must contacted Clerk of Courts with reasonable explanation as to why payment cannot be made.
Court authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment plan.
Court adjourned at 1:06 pm
sent to GLSO May 24, 2017

ADDRESS INFO for James A Straight
Current: 178 E 2nd St, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 11-02-2016)
Prior: 176 E 2nd St  Apt 1, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
from Clerk to Defendant re: Court-ordered payment plan
Payment Plan Agreement/Letter of Understanding
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Dave at GLSO.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

1:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  2015CM253 - Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Statement by the defendant.  DA makes sentence recommendation - upon plea will recommend a court costs and jail.  Statement by defendant - will accept offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court questions defendant regarding courtroom appearance.  Defendant will appear via video.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-7 days county jail, with huber and to commence immediately - 2 days of credit.
-Court waives the payment of court costs.  
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample..

2015CM5 - FTP $579.00.  Court makes statement to the defendant - will give the defendant $80.00 off for every day in jail or he can set up a payment plan.  Defendant requests to setup a payment plan.  Court questions defendant regarding amount of payment.  Statement by defendant.  Court sets pay plan of $10.00 per month commencing March 15, 2016 and every month thereafter.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.

Final Reminder Notice sent to Defendant has been returned.  Return to Sender.  Temporarily Away.
Settlement Form (PTC)

2:22 P.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Court recites plea agreement.  Defendant concurs.  DA concurs.  Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts wavier.  

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: $100.00 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to complete processing.

Court adjourned at 2:27 p.m.
